REF_M_AVIUM.Author: Falkinham
REF_M_AVIUM.Title: Mycobacterium avium complex: ecology, pathogenicity, and dose-response
REF_M_AVIUM.Notes: Exponential model; k=6.93E-4. Opportunistic pathogen primarily affecting immunocompromised

REF_P_AERUGINOSA.Author: QMRA Wiki / Hazlett et al.
REF_P_AERUGINOSA.Title: Pseudomonas aeruginosa: dose-response models
REF_P_AERUGINOSA.Notes: Exponential model; k=1.05E-4 (from Hazlett 1978 mouse ocular infection model)

REF_HEPATITIS_A.Author: US EPA / QMRA Wiki
REF_HEPATITIS_A.Title: Hepatitis A virus: dose-response models
REF_HEPATITIS_A.Notes: Exponential model; k=1.58E-4 per EPA (2000). Previously incorrectly listed as Beta-Poisson with alpha=0.253 (which was Rotavirus parameters).

REF_LEGIONELLA.Author: QMRA Wiki / Armstrong & Haas
REF_LEGIONELLA.Title: Legionella pneumophila: dose-response models
REF_LEGIONELLA.Notes: Exponential model; k=5.99E-2. DALY/case=0.97 based on case fatality 10-25% (Armstrong & Haas 2007)

REF_DALY_HAVELAAR.Author: Havelaar & Melse
REF_DALY_HAVELAAR.Title: Quantifying public health risk in the WHO Guidelines for Drinking-Water Quality
REF_DALY_HAVELAAR.Notes: Key source for DALY-per-case values: Rotavirus 1.4E-2, Crypto 1.5E-3, Giardia 1.5E-3

REF_DALY_HAVELAAR_2012.Author: Havelaar et al.
REF_DALY_HAVELAAR_2012.Title: World Health Organization Global Estimates and Regional Comparisons of the Burden of Foodborne Disease in 2010
REF_DALY_HAVELAAR_2012.Notes: Updated DALY burden estimates for Salmonella, Campylobacter, and other foodborne pathogens

REF_DALY_LEGIONELLA.Author: Hamilton et al.
REF_DALY_LEGIONELLA.Title: Risk-based critical concentrations of Legionella pneumophila for indoor residential water uses
REF_DALY_LEGIONELLA.Notes: Reports ~0.97 DALY/case for Legionella. Used for shower inhalation risk benchmarking.

REF_EXP_SHOWER.Author: US EPA
REF_EXP_SHOWER.Title: Exposure Factors Handbook
REF_EXP_SHOWER.Notes: Shower duration, water volume, inhalation rate parameters

REF_EXP_WHO.Author: WHO
REF_EXP_WHO.Title: Guidelines for the safe use of wastewater, excreta and greywater
REF_EXP_WHO.Notes: Exposure volumes and frequencies for various reuse activities

REF_EXP_HAAS.Author: Haas, Rose & Gerba
REF_EXP_HAAS.Title: Quantitative Microbial Risk Assessment, 2nd Edition
REF_EXP_HAAS.Notes: Foundational QMRA textbook; dose-response models, exposure assessment methods

REF_TREAT_WHO.Author: WHO
REF_TREAT_WHO.Title: Guidelines for the safe use of wastewater, excreta and greywater, Volume 4
REF_TREAT_WHO.Notes: Treatment log-reduction values for various processes and pathogen types

REF_TREAT_EPA_UV.Author: US EPA
REF_TREAT_EPA_UV.Title: Ultraviolet Disinfection Guidance Manual for the Final Long Term 2 Enhanced Surface Water Treatment Rule
REF_TREAT_EPA_UV.Notes: UV and membrane treatment LRV credits. Note: adenovirus requires 186 mJ/cm2 for 4-log, most other viruses 40 mJ/cm2 for 4-log.

REF_TREAT_HAAS.Author: Haas, Rose & Gerba
REF_TREAT_HAAS.Title: Quantitative Microbial Risk Assessment, 2nd Edition
REF_TREAT_HAAS.Notes: Ceramic membrane UF treatment performance data

REF_OCC_WST_2004.Author: Birks & Hills
REF_OCC_WST_2004.Title: Characterisation of indicator organisms and pathogens in domestic greywater for recycling
REF_OCC_WST_2004.Notes: Key source for E. coli (70000 CFU/L median), Giardia (0-1.2 cysts/L), Crypto (0-1.21 oocysts/L), Legionella (1500-7500 CFU/L) in hand basin greywater

REF_OCC_SCITOTENV_2014.Author: Li et al.
REF_OCC_SCITOTENV_2014.Title: Greywater characteristics and treatment performance — a review
REF_OCC_SCITOTENV_2014.Notes: Mixed greywater pathogen concentrations. E. coli median 12589, Pseudomonas 17784 CFU/L

REF_OCC_WATER_AIR_SOIL_2008.Author: Al-Jamal & Mahmoud
REF_OCC_WATER_AIR_SOIL_2008.Title: Irrigation with treated wastewater and health risks

REF_OCC_SCITOTENV_2023.Author: Tang et al.
REF_OCC_SCITOTENV_2023.Title: Occurrence of enteric viruses in greywater
REF_OCC_SCITOTENV_2023.Notes: Viral occurrence in greywater; used for virus concentration estimates

REF_OCC_WATRES_2018_STORM.Author: Steele et al.
REF_OCC_WATRES_2018_STORM.Title: Occurrence of pathogens and fecal indicators in urban stormwater runoff

REF_OCC_WATRES_2004_STORM.Author: Horman et al.
REF_OCC_WATRES_2004_STORM.Title: Occurrence of Giardia and Cryptosporidium in surface waters and urban runoff

REF_HAMILTON_2018.Author: Hamilton et al.
REF_HAMILTON_2018.Title: Quantitative microbial risk assessment for greywater reuse: Legionella risk from shower aerosols
REF_HAMILTON_2018.Notes: Reports Legionella raw conc 120000 CFU/L in some greywater systems; key comparison for shower inhalation QMRA

REF_BENAMI_2015.Author: Benami et al.
REF_BENAMI_2015.Title: Quantification of viable but non-culturable bacteria after disinfection
REF_BENAMI_2015.Notes: Demonstrates discrepancies between qPCR and culture-based pathogen detection post-disinfection
